page.title: 12Transport in Longfield
page.content: Most people own a car and many families own two. The area has a bus service run by London Country,and access to Dartford,Gravesend and New Ash Green is fairly easy. A service between Longfield Hill and New Barn runs on Fridays only. Longfield enjoys a half_hourly train service to London,Victoria. The cost is Â£6.40 return and the journey to Victoria _ via Swanley and Bromley South _ takes approximately forty minutes. People working in London use this service rather than driving in,and it would be disastrous should the service cease. There is a taxi service and more bicycles are to be seen on the roads. Schoolchildren living in outlying villages come in by coach and taxi to attend the schools in Longfield.
